definition: to put on airs/to assume great airs
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Here we get to eat as much as we want, and the men don't bother us!
sentences.chinese: 我们不愁吃不愁穿，又没有臭男人摆架子。

sentences.english: I like Norma because she's genuine person and never puts on side.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢诺马，因为她坦率真诚，从不摆架子。

sentences.english: Nobody can say I put on airs. I'm actually very humble.
sentences.chinese: 谁也不能说我这人摆架子，事实上我是很谦虚的人。

sentences.english: He can't stand for those who put on airs .
sentences.chinese: 他不能容忍摆架子的人。

sentences.english: Don’t try to pull rank on me. We’re all equals here.
sentences.chinese: 别对我摆架子，这里人人平等。

sentences.english: She simply can't stand for those who put on airs.
sentences.chinese: 她简直不能容忍那些摆架子的人。

sentences.english: We must respect the masses and avoid putting on airs.
sentences.chinese: 我们要尊重群众，不要摆架子。

sentences.english: Geez, the guy gets a solo adventure and he gets all snippy.
sentences.chinese: 去，这家伙跑了段单人剧情就开始摆架子了。

sentences.english: Norma because she's genuine person and never puts on side.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢诺马，因为她坦率真诚，从不摆架子。

sentences.english: Although she is a successful career woman, she never puts on airs.
sentences.chinese: 虽然她是个事有成的职业妇女，确从不摆架子。

sentences.english: He always put on airs with me, as if he was the boss.
sentences.chinese: 他总是对我摆架子，就好像他是老板一样。

sentences.english: That important man is very unassuming in his manner.
sentences.chinese: 那个要人彬彬有礼，是一位毫不摆架子的人。

sentences.english: But regardless of how much each person ends up paying, no one should feel the right to put on airs as a result.
sentences.chinese: 不过甭管付了多少钱，摆架子端姿态都是不应该的吧。

sentences.english: I find I can't stand for those who put on airs.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我不能忍受那些摆架子的人。

definition: to put on airs
to put on airs/to be ostentatious
to throw one's weight around/to put on airs
stinking pretension/to give oneself airs and offend others/hateful arrogance
pretentious/striking a pose
overbearing/arrogant bully
to talk officiously/to assume the air of a functionary/to talk in official jargon
putting on official airs
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
posturing/pretentious/affected
erhua variant of 擺譜|摆谱[bai3 pu3]
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
manner/style/panache
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
